intro: Chaetaria setifolia, commonly known as the silky chaetaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant has finely hairy leaves that give it a soft, velvety appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Due to its delicate structure and habitat preferences, it is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
